abilities.name: Fire Formation
abilities.text: Each of Charizard's attacks does 10 more damage for each Fire Pokémon on your Bench to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charizard.

abilities.name: Snow Gift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Froslass from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ground Frost
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium Card in play, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magma Mantle
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire or Metal Energy card you discarded.

attacks.name: Primal Scythe
attacks.text: You may discard Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber from your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Gadget Bolt
attacks.text: If Luxray has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, you may do 100 damage instead of 60 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, discard that Pokémon Tool card.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Competitiveness
abilities.text: If you don't have a Supporter card in play, each of Probopass's attacks does 30 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Top Chop
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Top Accelerator
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If that card isn't a basic Energy card, discard it. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Damage Roller
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until the Defending Pokémon has the same remaining HP as Swalot. (If the Defending Pokémon has the same or less remaining HP as Swalot, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Entangle Tackle
attacks.text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Tangrowth by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Tangrowth. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Tangrowth's, this attack does 120 damage instead.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Convert Blow
attacks.text: If Toxicroak has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If Toxicroak has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Zapdos G.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning attached to Zapdos G. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

abilities.name: Unearth
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber, show it your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Oracle Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Antigravity
attacks.text: The Retreat Cost for Bronzong is 0 until the end of your next turn.

abilities.name: Cloudy Sky
abilities.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon or Fire Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Skip
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Tumble Down
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. The attack does 30 damage times the number of Fighting Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Push Out
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 120 instead of 60.

abilities.name: Relaxing Shower
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy card from your hand. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Lopunny is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hover Heal
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Lopunny.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Primal Tentacles
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, and Old Amber in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Continuous Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu. 0 Baby Steps Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

abilities.name: Dowsing Code
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Porygon-Z G from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Boosted Voltage
attacks.text: If Raichu has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy card attached to Raichu.

abilities.name: Wild Guard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Rapidash by your opponent's Pokémon SP.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Recruit
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Supporter card you find there, and discard it. Then, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Extend Fang
attacks.text: If Raticate has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

abilities.name: Green Breath
abilities.text: When you attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Sceptile, remove 2 damage counters from Sceptile.

attacks.name: Leaf Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to Sceptile.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Leaf Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Keystone Seal
abilities.text: As long as Spiritomb is your Active Pokémon, each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand. 0 Darkness Grace Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) If you do, put 1 damage counter on Spiritomb. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Wide Laser
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Extrasensory
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Night Shade
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Graveler does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Grovyle during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Endure
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Gulpin would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Gulpin is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

abilities.name: Hidden Poison
abilities.text: If Haunter is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Haunter is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tongue Spring
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxio. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Water Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Pelipper.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Ponyta and put it onto Ponyta. (This counts as evolving Ponyta.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dragon Bump
attacks.text: If Shelgon has any basic Fire Energy and any basic Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Magical Needle
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cloak Scale
attacks.text: If you have Wormadam Sandy Cloak in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Cloak Headbutt
attacks.text: If you have Wormadam Trash Cloak in play, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Cloak Shard
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. If you have Wormadam Plant Cloak in play, this attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Serve Trash
attacks.text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If you played Beedrill G from your hand during this turn, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 10.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bunny Hop
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Plant Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Sandy Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

abilities.name: Cloak Evolution
abilities.text: Burmy Trash Cloak can evolve during the turn you play it.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrike does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Evolution cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Nosepass would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Nosepass if that damage is 30 or less.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Pikachu and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Tangela.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, Wingull can't use Slashing Strike.

name: Beginning Door
rules: Search your deck for Arceus, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Bench Shield
rules: As long as the Pokémon this card is attached to is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to that Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Buffer Piece
rules: Damage done to the Pokémon Buffer Piece is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.

name: Department Store Girl
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Expert Belt
rules: The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +20 HP and that Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 more Prize card.

name: Lucky Egg
rules: If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

name: Old Amber

abilities.name: Hard Amber
abilities.text: As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's). Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Professor Oak's Visit
rules: Draw 3 cards. Then, choose a card from your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Ultimate Zone
rules: During each player's turn, the player may move an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon to his or her Active Arceus as often as he or she likes.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Dome Fossil

abilities.name: Rock Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Helix Fossil

abilities.name: Aqua Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Multi-type
abilities.text: Arceus LV. X's type is the same type as its previous Level.

abilities.name: Omniscient
abilities.text: Arceus can use the attacks of all Arceus you have in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

abilities.name: Multitype
abilities.text: Arceus LV.X's type is the same as its previous Level.

attacks.name: Meteor Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 100.

abilities.name: Multitype
abilities.text: Arceus LV.X's type is the same type as its previous Level.

attacks.name: Psychic Bolt
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy and a Psychic Energy attached to Arceus.

abilities.name: Level-Down
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon LV.X. Remove the Level-Up card from that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck. The power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Compound Pain
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Double Fall
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Salamence LV.X from your hand onto your Active Salamence, you may use this power. For each of your opponent's Pokémon that is Knocked Out by damage from Salamence's attacks this turn, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Steam Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Salamence.

abilities.name: Healing Growth
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Tangrowth is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Big Growth
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for as many Grass Energy cards as you like and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.
